visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a 3D column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: Monthly Average Rainfall, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#00008B) for the title and axis labels, with a font size of 14px. Data series: The series should represent monthly rainfall data with the name 'Rainfall' and data points [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4]. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#00008B) for the columns. Additional configurations: Enable 3D options with alpha and beta set to 15 degrees, depth set to 50, and column depth set to 25. Set the chart margin to 75 pixels.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a 3D column chart with specific styling and data series. The chart type is set to 'column', and 3D options are enabled with alpha and beta angles of 15 degrees and a depth of 50. The chart title is 'Monthly Average Rainfall', styled with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The x and y axes labels are also styled with the same dark blue color and font size. The data series represents monthly rainfall data, named 'Rainfall', with specific data points. The columns are colored with a gradient from light blue to dark blue, enhancing the visual appeal. Additional configurations include setting the chart margin to 75 pixels and adjusting the column depth to 25 for better 3D effect.
